sentences: Ta ei tea seda ega nad.
Ma ei saa seda teha, ka mitte sina ega kellegi teisi.
Ega k√µikjal mujal maailmas pole nii musta nagu siin.
context: The Estonian word 'ega' translates to the English coordinating conjunction 'nor,' used to join two or more negative clauses together. It is commonly employed in formal and informal speech when negation has already been introduced by a negative particle such as 'ei.'
